alert.note: Alert for Grand (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 20 at 2:47PM MDT until further notice by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Utah... Colorado River near Cisco affecting Grand County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Colorado River near Cisco. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Forecast hydrographs oscillate flow along the Colorado between 39,000 to 42,500 cfs upstream the confluence with the Dolores through the weekend. However, flows ramp up above 41,000 cfs below the confluence. Forecast peak within the 10 day forecast is anticipated next week, exceeding 44,000 cfs through Moab. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM MDT Saturday the stage was 14.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 15.8 feet Friday afternoon May 26th. - Action stage is 13.3 feet. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
